newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia c.bank to cut reserve requirement.
newsitem.headline: Croatia c.bank to cut reserve requirement.

text.p: Croatia's Central bank (NBH) will cut its reserve requirement by two percentage points to 31.85 percent in July, in light of overall financial stability, the bank said in a statement on Wednesday.
The decrease will become effective on July 7, said the statement, faxed to Reuters.

NBH will step up its interventions on the foreign exchange market throughout the summer tourist season to prevent an appreciation of the Croatian currency, kuna, because of increased inflows of hard currency, it said.
The weighted rate of interbank kuna loans fell to 15.8 percent in May, the lowest since the beginning of 1995, the NBH statement said. -- Zoran Radosavljevic, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
